diagnosis: High‑severity hard impact at joint J1 with concurrent high‑temperature alert immediately after joint calibration, indicating potential thermal stress, motor overload, or post‑maintenance misalignment.
inspection_steps:
- Inspect J1 motor housing and cabling for heat discoloration or impact deformation
- Check J1 thermal sensors for drift or loose connections
- Verify J1 torque sensor readings for post‑impact offsets
- Examine reducer and bearing set for shock-induced play or abnormal noise
- Review controller logs for temperature spikes or current surges around the event
maintenance_actions:
- Recalibrate J1 motor temperature sensor and validate against reference probe
- Perform J1 joint backlash and smooth‑motion test under low load
- Apply fresh lubrication to J1 reducer if temperature caused viscosity breakdown
- Tighten or realign J1 mechanical interfaces if impact shifted calibration
- Run a controlled torque profile test to confirm normal thermal rise
safety_clearance:
- Lock out power and engage mechanical joint support
- Allow J1 motor assembly to cool to safe handling temperature
- Verify no secondary damage to adjacent harnesses or panels
- Confirm area free of residual collision hazards before energizing
return_to_service:
- Complete thermal stability check during a 10‑minute idle cycle
- Validate joint path accuracy and torque response under supervised motion
- Clear collision and temperature alerts and recheck sensor baselines
- Approve full operation only after completing impact recovery checklist

diagnosis: High‑severity hard impact recorded at Joint 1 immediately after joint calibration, indicating probable mechanical shock to the J1 drive train or misalignment introduced during calibration.
inspection_steps:
- Inspect J1 joint housing for deformation, cracks, or shifted mounting surfaces
- Check J1 motor flange, gearbox interface, and torque-sensor mounting for mechanical looseness
- Review post-calibration offsets for J1 to confirm no erroneous zero-point shift occurred
- Verify wiring harness and connector integrity around J1 for strain or partial pull-out
- Examine robot workcell for external obstructions or unexpected contact at time of event
maintenance_actions:
- Recalibrate J1 with a controlled sequence to confirm proper zero and torque baselines
- Torque‑check J1 mechanical fasteners (motor, gearbox, coupling)
- Perform a slow‑speed motion test under observation to validate smooth rotation and torque profile
- If abnormal torque persists, perform advanced diagnostics on J1 gearbox and motor bearings
safety_clearance:
- Lock out robot power and secure energy sources before inspection
- Physically block robot arm to prevent unintended rotation of J1
- Confirm workcell free of external objects that may have caused the impact
return_to_service:
- Validate J1 torque telemetry during low‑speed and nominal‑speed test cycles
- Ensure no repeated collision flags in a controlled dry run
- Document calibration results and restore robot to full operation only after confirming stable torque and alignment

diagnosis: High‑severity emergency stop triggered at Joint 6. Torque level indicates abrupt halt but no repeated pattern. Likely operator-initiated E-stop; verify no mechanical obstruction or wiring fault at J6.
inspection_steps:
- Inspect J6 cabling and connectors for damage or pinching
- Verify E-stop circuitry integrity, including buttons and wiring
- Check J6 brake response and confirm no residual torque or binding
- Review robot logs for any pre-stop anomalies
maintenance_actions:
- Reset and test E-stop chain functionality
- Lubricate and manually articulate J6 to confirm smooth movement
- Run joint torque sensor calibration check
- Clear any debris or obstruction around J6 work envelope
safety_clearance:
- Confirm E-stop system passes full functional test
- Ensure no personnel or object intrusion zones triggered the stop
- Validate controller fault logs show no unresolved safety faults
return_to_service:
- Perform low-speed J6 motion test cycle
- Run full robot homing and safety validation routine
- Approve return only if all torque, brake, and E-stop checks pass

diagnosis: Critical emergency stop triggered during high torque load on Joint 5 immediately after motor replacement, indicating possible installation issue, wiring fault, or unintended external activation.
inspection_steps:
- Verify E-stop button condition and rule out accidental operator activation
- Inspect J5 motor installation for alignment, mounting torque, and connector seating
- Check post-maintenance wiring harness for pinched, loose, or misrouted cables
- Review controller logs for simultaneous faults or overcurrent events
- Manually rotate J5 (powered-off) to confirm absence of mechanical binding
maintenance_actions:
- Reseat and torque-check J5 motor mounting hardware
- Reinspect and, if necessary, reterminate J5 motor and encoder connectors
- Perform continuity and insulation tests on E-stop circuit and J5 wiring
- Run low-speed, low-load functional test on J5 to validate torque behavior
- Update maintenance record with findings from the immediate post-replacement event
safety_clearance:
- Lock out and tag out all power sources prior to inspection
- Verify E-stop circuit integrity before re-energizing
- Confirm no personnel are within robot reach zone during functional tests
return_to_service:
- Complete full joint motion test across full range at increasing speeds
- Validate torque readings remain within nominal thresholds
- Clear all fault logs and confirm no recurrence over multiple cycles
- Authorize system restart only after supervisor review of test results

diagnosis: Joint 6 exceeded torque limits at a critical level, indicating potential mechanical binding, worn bearings, or obstruction despite recent sensor cleaning.
inspection_steps:
- Manually verify J6 for mechanical resistance or abnormal stiffness
- Inspect J6 wiring, connectors, and torque sensor harness for damage
- Check for foreign objects or debris around the J6 rotary interface
- Review recent motion logs for patterns of overload or unexpected stops
maintenance_actions:
- Lubricate J6 rotational components and verify bearing condition
- Perform torque sensor calibration for J6
- Realign and re-torque J6 fasteners to manufacturer specs
- Remove any obstructions and clear workspace paths
- If binding persists, schedule partial disassembly of J6 drivetrain
safety_clearance:
- Lockout/tagout robot power before inspection
- Physically secure end-effector to prevent unexpected motion
- Confirm zero-energy state of all axes before manual manipulation
- Maintain exclusion zone until torque integrity is verified
return_to_service:
- Run J6 no-load motion test across full range
- Perform torque profile verification at low, medium, and nominal loads
- Validate collision detection thresholds and confirm no abnormal spikes
- Approve restart only after stable torque readings and smooth motion are confirmed
